marketNews.title: RI Aims for 0% Tariff for Premium Exports to the US
marketNews.content: Secretary of the Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs, Susiwijono Moegiarso, said that the government is working to achieve a 0% tariff for a number of premium export commodities to the United States, such as crude palm oil (CPO), coffee, cocoa, and nickel. He noted that the commodities proposed for the 0% tariff may still change because a final list has not been established. As a substitute, Susiwijono mentioned that US technology products will be exempted from the domestic component requirement (TKDN). He added that all US goods imported into Indonesia will not be subject to any tariff, except alcoholic beverages and pork meat. Some US goods will also be exempt from import quota rules. Susiwijono is optimistic that tariff negotiations can be reached, especially for commodities highly demanded by the US. Indonesia is the main supplier of CPO to the US, contributing 85% of total US CPO imports in 2024. Meanwhile, the US is the fourth largest destination for Indonesian CPO exports, accounting for about 7% of total Indonesian CPO export volume in 2023. Previously, President Prabowo Subianto's advisor and member of the National Economic Council, Mari Elka Pangestu, told Bloomberg last week that after securing a 19% tariff, Indonesia will continue negotiating with the US on sectoral tariffs, Boeing aircraft purchases, and important minerals. Pangestu also explained that Indonesia will grant broader access for US imports that do not directly compete with Indonesian products, such as wheat and cotton. Key Takeaway: Reducing tariffs for the mentioned commodities could positively impact Indonesian exports, but the effect may not be very significant, according to us. This is because demand for Indonesia's two flagship commodities—CPO and nickel—is dominated by China (and also India for CPO). We assess that investors will still focus, at least in the near term, on domestic economic developments, especially the government's efforts to boost purchasing power. Recent economic indicator data—such as credit growth, car sales, and cement sales—show that the domestic economy remains challenging.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics to Know
marketNews.content:
1. President Prabowo Subianto inaugurated the Red-White Village Cooperative (Kopdes) program on Monday (21/7). Minister of Cooperatives, Budi Arie Setiadi, said that about 80,500 Red-White Kopdes have been established, with 103 cooperatives selected as pilot examples. Initial financing for the Red-White Kopdes will be channeled through a special KUR with a ceiling of up to 3 billion rupiah per cooperative.
2. Minister of Communication and Digital, Meutya Hafid, said on Saturday (19/7) that the ministry does not plan to restrict basic video-call or voice-over-IP (VoIP) services. The statement came after the director of the Ministry of Communication and Digital, Denny Setiawan, mentioned that the ministry is studying the issue to encourage over-the-top (OTT) service contributions related to bandwidth investment.
3. A judge of the Corruption Crime Court sentenced former Trade Minister Thomas Lembong to four years and six months in prison for alleged sugar-import corruption covering 2015-2016, although the judge noted that Lembong did not benefit from the illicit proceeds. The case involved a loss to the state of 578.1 billion rupiah due to the issuance of raw sugar import permits to ten companies without inter-ministerial coordination or recommendation from the Ministry of Industry.
4. Chinese Premier Li Qiang announced the start of construction of the world’s largest hydropower dam on the eastern edge of the Tibetan Plateau. The project, valued at 170 billion US dollars, will have five power stations with a total generation capacity of 300 billion kWh per year, equivalent to the electricity consumption of the United Kingdom in 2024.

tickerNews.title: Prajogo Pangestu buys 3 million BREN shares at average price 7,944 IDR
tickerNews.content: Prajogo Pangestu, controlling Barito Renewables Energy, bought 3 million BREN shares at an average price of 7,944 Indonesian rupiah per share on 21 July 2025. The total transaction value was approximately 23.8 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Prajogo Pangestu’s direct ownership in BREN increased from 0.10125% to 0.10349%.

tickerNews.title: Garuda Indonesia announces 2Q25 financial report and shareholder loan conversion
tickerNews.content: Garuda Indonesia announced that it will release its 2Q25 financial report after audit by a public accountant, as part of a planned restructuring of the company through a shareholder loan and capital increase from Danantara. GIAA stated that its subsidiary PT Citilink Indonesia will act as obligor for the shareholder loan. The loan will be converted into shares by Danantara and followed by an additional capital injection. GIAA also said it will obtain a valuation from a public appraisal office to determine the fair value of the shares to be issued in the capital increase. Previously, Danantara announced in June 2025 that it would provide a shareholder loan of USD 405 million or IDR 6.65 trillion to GIAA, which is part of financing support designed to reach USD 1 billion.

tickerNews.title: ACES reports same-store sales contraction in June 2025
tickerNews.content: Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia reported same-store sales growth (SSSG) of minus 4.8% year-on-year in June 2025 (versus minus 4.6% in May 2025 and plus 8.7% in June 2024). This result caused 1H25 SSSG to contract by 2.9% YoY (versus a 10.7% increase in 1H24), below the 2025 target of more than plus 1% YoY. During 1H25, SSSG slowed across all regions, with outside Java at minus 0.9% YoY, Java outside Jakarta at minus 3.8% YoY, and Jakarta at minus 4.5% YoY.

tickerNews.title: MTEL plans up to 4.12% share buyback funded by 1 trillion rupiah
tickerNews.content: Dayamitra Telekomunikasi plans to conduct a share buyback of up to 4.12% of its shares with a funding allocation of up to 1 trillion rupiah. The plan will be discussed at the extraordinary general shareholders meeting on 26 August 2025, and the implementation period is expected to last up to 12 months after shareholder approval.

tickerNews.title: SSIA records 13.1 hectares land sales in 1H25
tickerNews.content: The Vice President of Investor Relations & Sustainability of Surya Semesta Internusa, Erlin Budiman, told Kontan that SSIA recorded land sales of 13.1 hectares during 1H25 (versus 7.6 hectares in 1Q25), equivalent to about 10% of its 2025 target of 137 hectares. The value of the land sales was not disclosed. Erlin also said that the company's subsidiary Nusa Raya Cipta (NRCA) recorded new contract value of 1.42 trillion rupiah during 1H25, about 38% of the 2025 target of 3.75 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: ADHI reports 3.5 trillion rupiah new contracts in 1H25
tickerNews.content: The Company Secretary of Adhi Karya, Rozi Sparta, told Kontan that the company recorded new contract value of 3.5 trillion rupiah during 1H25 (down 66% YoY), representing 12.5-14% of the 2025 target of 25-28 trillion rupiah. According to the source, the new contracts in 1H25 came from state-owned enterprises/state-owned businesses (33%), government (24%), private sector (20%), loans (15%) and the remainder from internal sources.

tickerNews.title: INET shareholder purchases ~19.8 million shares
tickerNews.content: The controlling shareholder of Sinergi Inti Andalan Prima, PT Abadi Kreasi Unggul Nusantara, bought approximately 19.8 million INET shares at an average price of about 253 rupiah per share on 17 July 2025. The total transaction value was about 5 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Abadi Kreasi Unggul Nusantara’s ownership in INET increased from 64.35% to 64.59%.

tickerNews.title: Vale Indonesia to reschedule board change agenda
tickerNews.content: Vale Indonesia (INCO) will reschedule the agenda for changing the company's board, including the appointment of a new president director. This follows the cancellation of the extraordinary general shareholders meeting on 18 July 2025 due to lack of quorum. Currently, the president director position is held on an interim basis by Bernardus Irmanto, who replaced Febriany Eddy after he resigned to become Managing Director at PT Danantara Asset Management.

tickerNews.title: PGAS to hold extraordinary shareholders meeting on 27 August 2025
tickerNews.content: Perusahaan Gas Negara (PGAS) announced that it will hold an extraordinary general shareholders meeting on 27 August 2025 with the agenda of changing the company's board. Previously, PGAS announced in early July 2025 that the term of board member Harry Budi Sidharta ended as he was appointed to the board of PT Pertamina International Shipping.

tickerNews.title: BUVA plans rights issue of up to 4.8 billion new shares
tickerNews.content: Bukit Uluwatu Villa (BUVA) plans to carry out a rights issue of up to 4.8 billion new shares, with a maximum dilution effect of 18.9%. The issue price and ratio have not been announced, while the proceeds will be used for business development, capital expenditures, and/or repayment of company liabilities. The plan will be discussed at the extraordinary general shareholders meeting on 22 July 2025. Previously, BUVA announced a rights issue of up to 3.6 billion new shares scheduled for the extraordinary general shareholders meeting on 24 March 2025, but the plan was cancelled because the company needed more time to review and discuss with relevant parties.
